meanings.definition: To humble oneself in a demeaning way.
meanings.sent1: He groveled before his boss, hoping for forgiveness.
meanings.sent2: The beggar groveled at the feet of the wealthy merchant.
meanings.sent3: The dog groveled for a treat, wagging its tail eagerly.
meanings.sent4: She groveled for attention, seeking approval from everyone.
meanings.sent5: The politician groveled for votes, making promises left and right.

meanings.definition: To act in a servile manner.
meanings.sent1: The loyal servant groveled before his master, ready to obey any command.
meanings.sent2: She groveled to the celebrity, hoping to gain favor.
meanings.sent3: The student groveled to the teacher, hoping for a better grade.
meanings.sent4: He groveled to the tyrant, fearing the consequences of defiance.
meanings.sent5: The employee groveled to the manager, seeking a promotion.

meanings.definition: To lie or crawl on the ground in a submissive way.
meanings.sent1: The defeated warrior groveled in front of the conqueror.
meanings.sent2: The thief groveled on the floor, begging for mercy.
meanings.sent3: The cat groveled playfully, trying to catch a toy.
meanings.sent4: The toddler groveled on the grass, exploring the world from a new angle.
meanings.sent5: The injured bird groveled on the pavement, unable to fly.
